eu_initiatives:
IMCA is interested in all EU activities, initiatives and regulatory processes which are related to the offshore energy (including oil, gas and renewables) and maritime sectors. 
This includes potential extension of the product directives to the MODU sector, carbon monitoring, reporting & verification initiatives, the security directive and offshore liability. 
IMCA participates in the EU offshore authorities group (EUOAG).

relevant_communication:
IMCA publishes a range of good practice guidance documents which are intended to promote effective self regulation of the marine contracting sector. IMCA's main areas of activity are diving, survey, rigging and lifting, contracts & insurance, vessel assurance, dynamic positioning (DP) and health and safety. 
IMCA publishes regular safety flashes which raise awareness of safety incidents and operates an industry recognised DP event reporting scheme which captures learning opportunities and is used to improve DP safety. IMCA provides diver certification and is a non-governmental observer member of the International Maritime Organisation. 
IMCA activities are overseen by a series of core activity and technical division committees which in turn oversee working groups. Regular meetings are held in each of IMCA's geographical sections. 
IMCA publishes a quarterly magazine, Making Waves, and hosts an annual seminar as well as workshop events.
goals__remit: The International Marine Contractors Association (IMCA) is the international trade association representing companies and organisations engaged in delivering offshore, marine and underwater solutions. Our core purpose is improving performance in the marine contracting industry by championing better regulation and enhancing operational integrity.
